newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-PARMA AIM TO PILE ON THE AGONY FOR INTER.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-PARMA AIM TO PILE ON THE AGONY FOR INTER.

text.p: Parma aim to make Internazionale suffer again at their Tardini stadium on Saturday when the teams clash in Serie A with a possible European Cup Champions' League place at stake.

Second-placed Parma are five points behind Juventus and two in front of third-placed Inter, and victory could give them a significant push towards ensuring runners-up spot and a place in next season's Champions' League.

Parma may be helped by Inter's dismal record at the Tardini, a ground where they have never won, managing only two draws and four defeats in six appearances since March 1991, Parma's first season in Serie A.
Inter midfielder Nicola Berti is a former Parma player, born at the nearby town of Salsomaggiore, and he is eager to improve the Inter record at his old club.
"We've got to go there looking for a win. I never try to play safe, I always want to win...and this Inter is well capable of doing so," he said.
"Sure, Parma are going well but we're in great form and a big surprise cannot be ruled out."
Berti's fighting words are countered by Parma midfielder Dino Baggio, who still believes in his side's title chances.
"Sure, they're a good team and in good form but it's vital for us to win this game. This is our chance to show what we're made of," he said.

Inter, held 0-0 by Juventus last Sunday, come into the game with a full squad and may be tempted to make changes with a view to their UEFA Cup quarter-final second leg tie at home to Belgian side Anderlecht next Tuesday.
Striker Maurizio Ganz, Argentine midfielder Javier Zanetti and defender Fabio Galante may all be rested, being replaced by Marco Branca, Berti and Alessandro Pistone respectively.
Parma will be without suspended Croat midfielder Mario Stanic, leaving Massimo Crippa, Pietro Strada and Argentine Nestor Sensini to join Baggio in midfield.
Winners of eight of their last 10 games, Parma look to Argentine Hernan Crespo and Enrico Chiesa in attack.
